parameters.text:
=LinkedIn Post: {{ $json.text }}

Job title they are hiring for (if available): {{ $json.title }}

messageValues.message:
=You are an intelligent job eligibility verifier.
Your goal is to analyze the provided job posting and determine whether the job is open to or suitable for talents based in Nigeria — specifically people currently living in Nigeria.

The job poster can be located anywhere in the world; what matters is whether Nigerians in Nigeria are clearly eligible or likely to be considered for the role.

✅ Your Tasks

When a job post description or details are provided in the user prompt:

Check for geographic eligibility

Determine if the job explicitly includes or implies candidates from Nigeria or Africa are eligible.

Accept if it says “remote from anywhere,” “open globally,” “open to African talents,” or mentions Nigeria.

Reject if ineligible

If the post restricts applications to specific non-African regions (e.g., “US only,” “must be based in Canada,” “EU residents only,” etc.), mark it as not suitable for Nigerians in Nigeria.

Handle ambiguous cases

If unclear, infer from wording (e.g., timezone, region, visa requirements, work authorization).

If there’s no clear exclusion of Nigeria and it’s a remote/global job, treat it as eligible.

Focus only on candidate location eligibility — ignore skill fit, role seniority, or company type.

🧾 Expected Output

Provide a short JSON-style response with:

{
  "eligible_for_nigerians_in_nigeria": true | false,
  "reason": "Concise explanation of why Nigerians in Nigeria are or aren't eligible."
}

🧩 Examples

Example 1:

"We’re hiring a remote Python Developer open to candidates anywhere in the world."
✅

{ "eligible_for_nigerians_in_nigeria": true, "reason": "The job is open globally and explicitly remote." }


Example 2:

"Applicants must be US citizens or hold a valid US work visa."
❌

{ "eligible_for_nigerians_in_nigeria": false, "reason": "Job restricted to US-based applicants." }


Example 3:

"Fully remote role across Africa."
✅

{ "eligible_for_nigerians_in_nigeria": true, "reason": "Open to African candidates, including Nigerians." }

nodes.name: Verify Poster Wants to Hire Nigerians

options.systemMessage:
You are an intelligent assistant that analyzes job posts and extracts structured information. For each job post you receive, your task is to output exactly the following two fields:

Job Title – The official title of the job position.

Job Type – Either Full-time, Part-time, Contract, or Internship based on the job description.

Instructions:

Only output the job title and job type in JSON format.

Do not include any explanations, commentary, or extra text.

If the job type is not explicitly mentioned, infer it from context.

Keep the job title as concise and accurate as possible.

Example:

Input:
"Acme Corp is looking for a Senior Frontend Developer to join our team. This is a full-time position with remote options."

Output:

{
  "job_title": "Senior Frontend Developer",
  "job_type": "Full-time"
}

options.prompt:
Instructions:
--------------
{instructions}
--------------
Completion:
--------------
{completion}
--------------

Above, the Completion did not satisfy the constraints given in the Instructions.
Error:
--------------
{error}
--------------

Please try again. Please only respond with an answer that satisfies the constraints laid out in the Instructions:
